title: Objectification Theory-Based Rational Number Awareness Instructional Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of fraction concepts (part-whole relationships, ratios) and measurement activities
context.additional_context: Practice-centered program to strengthen pre-service/inservice elementary teachers' ability to design activities that objectify rational number concepts. Emphasizes math education approaches reflecting social interaction and historical context.

learning_goals: Learners can design two or more activities where they use measurement tools to express the comparative relationship between two quantities as rational numbers.
Learners can develop three mathematical modeling tasks emphasizing the proportional meaning of fractions based on objectification theory.
Learners can create a lesson plan explaining the socioconstructivist characteristics of the rational number recognition process by incorporating peer feedback.

resources: Measuring rulers, scales, comparative physical materials
Small-group activity kit for promoting social interaction
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
